Legal_Issue: Whether the RAD erred in applying a reasonableness standard to review the RPD's decision
Evidence_Assessment: Key findings were not solely based on applicant testimony
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish refugee protection claim
Legal_Rule: RAD decisions on standard of review are assessed on correctness; RPD decisions require independent review unless credibility is critical
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness standard incorrectly applied by RAD; correct standard is independent review
Procedural_Issue: RAD failed to conduct required independent review
Grounds_for_Claim: Refugee status claim based on fear of persecution
Decision_Maker: Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB), Refugee Appeal Division (RAD)
Review_Standard: Correctness for RAD's standard of review determination
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Procedural fairness compromised due to incorrect standard of review
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged RAD's application of reasonableness standard
Legal_Rule_Source: Statute and case law interpreting IRPA
Remedy_Requested: Setting aside RAD decision, referral back for reconsideration
Outcome: Decision set aside, case remanded to new RAD panel
Remedy_Sought: Reconsideration by RAD with proper standard of review
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review followed by administrative reconsideration
Legal_Provision: Sections of IRPA relating to refugee appeals and standard of review
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA provisions on appeal process and standard of review
Governing_Rule: RAD must apply correctness or independent review where credibility is not central
